And buff Akali in the end? No. Bloody. Way.
Solution: gut Akali first, then make hybrid itemization a thing
This^ Akali makes hybrid a bad thing, rework her and then give us back hybrid champs and items!

On PBE, Xypherous gave a pretty good explanation as to why hybrid items can't coexist with hybrid champions (in a game with mostly non-hybrid champions) without either having to be underpowered. [(here's the Rioter Rundown, since specific links to posts seem to not be working for me properly)](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/K6OeAZ7t-experimental-preseason-2015-changes-hitting-the-pbe-over-the-next-few-days?show=rundown)

Here is the specific quote:

> It doesn't seem like hybrid items add much to the game because it seems to flatten hybrid characters entirely and lock them to a small subset of items.

> Let me walk through this a bit:

> Let's say no hybrid items exist - but the character is a hybrid character and all their skills have AD and AP ratios.

> This hybrid character can then build any item in the game and benefit because it doesn't "waste" any statistics from any AD or AP item. This character could build Zhonya's and Bloodthirster, knowing that their DPS would go up. They can't build crit - but they could effortlessly pick up a lot of mage utility items and sustained AD items.

> However, add hybrid items into the game, like gunblade. Do you expect the item to be better on hybrid characters than non-hybrid? Well, then it has to give both AD and AP - in better ratios than most other items. Inevitably, what this does is bind the above character to only building that hybrid item.

> If that character is OP with that hybrid item, the character gets nerfed to accommodate for that hybrid item and the character is balanced around that hybrid item existing -or- you nerf the hybrid item and then you get to the point of why did you even add that in the first place?

> So what happens? Well, now - said character loses the ability to build non-hybrid items when hybrid items are strong. It basically takes a character that could work well with any item in the game and collapses them down to whatever hybrid items you've made. The strength of hybrid characters is that literally no item is bad on them and they can forge builds that are way more powerful than most people can imagine.

> When you make decent hybrid items, you basically destroy these builds and lock them into your hybrid items as they are by default, the most efficient build path. It gets worse when down the line, if the character gets rebalanced assuming the purchase of hybrid items as now they are locked into the item's existence.

> This is why I've continuously stated my preference for Kayle's old AD --> AP and AP --> AD conversion passive. She could build whatever she wanted and she always ended up as a hybrid character that needed to use all her spells and her attacks in order to succeed. I think our current 'hybrid' characters tend to build either AD or AP because nothing in their kits forces them or causes them to benefit from both AD and AP compared to the power of % penetration.

> The more you focus your damage type into a single type of damage, the more powerful % penetration becomes and thus, it's mostly pointless to not focus on a certain type of damage.

> That said, I don't work on champions at the moment so these kinds of thoughts are mostly theoretical at best.

It isn't just Akali that's an issue (although I did get a facetious "The answer to "why not" is always Akali" out of him. :P)

The issue is that when hybrid items are strong, ALL hybrid champions have to be balanced around *needing to build hybrid itemization* (instead of being supremely versatile--which is arguably half the point to playing a hybrid champion.) When hybrid CHAMPIONS are strong, hybrid items have to be weak...and then the hybrids just build AD or AP because Last Whisper or Void Staff scale their damage better than building AD+AP both could ever dream to.

I think that logic is very flawed and mostly lazy:

They just would have to make sure each build is situational. A Champ could supportive/Aoe on AP, DPS/Single-Target on AD and e.g. a tad bit of both with a very strong mid- ,but a worse lategame as tradeoff as hybrid.

>The more you focus your damage type into a single type of damage, the more powerful % penetration becomes and thus, it's mostly pointless to not focus on a certain type of damage.

this pretty much makes sure the there´s a trade-off lategame for hybrid-builds, so I don´t see problems for allowing them to be strong in their specific niche.

> And buff Akali in the end? No. Bloody. Way.

She's more reliant on burst, so I doubt it would make that much of a difference on her--especially now that they took out her W resistances--unless it's a pro Akali player, in which case you probably would have lost anyway.  This would be more of a buff for sustained hybrid builds like Hybrid MF, Varus, Kayle, and Jax (okay those last two would be scary, so if they did put this passive on gunblade, they should nerf them somewhat--at least their Q's).
Why is locking Jax and Kayle into building Gunblade a good thing?

Did I ever say they had to be locked into building it? If nerfing them is a problem, just nerf some of the numbers on Gunblade instead (probably the active damage at least).

Xypherous is using the same lazy, faulty logic that Narrative used when retconning the Institute of War and Summoners out of the lore:  "We don't want to bother balancing it, working with it, etc, so we're just going to delete it instead."

I don't understand why they suddenly became averse to hybrid champions.

Because they'll still do some damage to you if you only itemize against once stat? Well that's the entire point.

No, it's because standard hybrid items have to be too strong for hybrids if you want anyone besides hybrids (who SHOULD be building a combination of AD and AP items) to consider picking them up. If you want them to ONLY work on hybrids without making them mandatory on hybrids (which would defeat the point of having a hybrid champion in the first place), then you have to make them weak to the point the hybrids might as well build Last Whisper and Void Staff and use only one of their scaling damage stats anyway.

i see not that big problem in tweaking them in a way that makes them more or less madatory on chamos that can utilize all stats they give well without beeing broken.
all that hybrid-items are missing is a better way to scale into the late without giving an overpowered midgame, and there are suggestions for that, like an items that gives u a % off ur ap as ad and a % of ur ad as ap(old kayle passive)
This item couldn'T really be abused by non hybrid champs, and it would allow hybrid items to scale in the late without beeing to strong in midgame.
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Ed4GHfgk-we-need-a-true-hybrid-dps-item-foe-lategame

Blame that one forum-goer, to whom Xypherous has replied about getting rid of hybrid items.

I guess the lesson here is that only items that are bought matter. They may be complete garbage, like Sunfire, but as long as someone is buying them, Riot is not gonna bother touching them.
sunfire is garbage.... what?
It has worse stats than Randuin's, it's passive just got nerfed a bit ago, Randuin's is better for sticking to carries, and Randuin's only costs about 300 more gold.
That doesn't make it bad though. If someone wants even more armour outside of Randuin's than Sunfire becomes a good choice. DO YOU REALLY WANT TO SEE THE SAD FACE OF {{champion:33}} ?

> That doesn't make it bad though. If someone wants even more armour outside of Randuin's than Sunfire becomes a good choice. DO YOU REALLY WANT TO SEE THE SAD FACE OF {{champion:33}} ?

Agreed. Sunfire is very good on pure tanks. The longer the other team ignores you in teamfights, the more damage they all take from you. This can be especially bad for their ADC if you are harassing them.
It's also pretty good on MR pen Malphite, Sunfire>Abyssal Scepter is pretty strong with his other AOE magic damage.

Bad stats, bad passive damage, bad passive range. Don't know about you, but when I play tanks, I never get to stay on priority targets for more than 3 seconds at best. Pay over 2500 gold for something like 80 magic damage? Well, how about no.

If you can get away with building Sunfire, you can get away with building pure damage as well. Like Liandry. At least Liandry's damage scales properly.
If you look at how damage mitigation works, you can see how on a full tank build get the extra damage from Sunfire aura is more profitable than get 20-30 extra armor from a different major armor item

*Some* damage in full tank builds no longer works, this isn't Season 3 anymore. There's a reason why the likes of Zac have disappeared from the competetive scene. If you want to deal damage, you have to build damage, or just be a meat wall and hope your team can do the rest. Sunfire is crappy at doing damage, and it's crappy at being a tank item. Hence, no reason to get it, outside of splitpushing, maybe.

Tanks that scale with AP have some alternative choice for tankiness + damage, as the Liandry/Rylai you quoted, but AA/AS/AD reliant tanks?
What are their options to get tankiness + a bit of damage?
Frozen mallet and its pitiful 30 AD? Atma's that require however to build health(which is discouraged from S2 and is almost going to be deleted)? Trinity Force which benefit little the champs that does not scale with AP anyway? The Black Cleaver that has only 200 health? Thornamil which doesn't deal damage against team with a balanced7strong Ap composition and/or doesn't use much AA?
Sunfire IS the best option available for tankiness + damage for champs that does not scale with AP, there is very very little to debate. That's why there is a place for it in the game and that's why many people pick it even though after the changes its damage output has been nerfed early to mid game

>What are their options to get tankiness + a bit of damage?

Welp, did you even read my comment? You don't build like that anymore, the masteries discourage it. Back in Season 3 low-tier penetration masteries ensured your base damage (and by extension, Sunfire's damage) would scale overtime. This is not the case anymore. As such, you either need to build pure damage items, which synergize with themselves, or build pure durability, and hope that you can still win by being a meat wall. By building a mix of the two, you're essentially hurting yourself, since you really won't get either.

If you keep not listening and remain stubbornly with wrong ides is your fault.
Look back at my first reply and at how damage mitigation work. For champs IS better to get some damage at expense of renouncing to some defense that would be superfluous, as over a certain point 30 extra armor reduce only a little amount of damage

And I don't see Bruiser as class being in trouble(champs that itemize a mix of damage and defense), so your argument seem to fail again

*>*refers to the old "diminishing returns on resits" fallacy as true
*>*anecdotal evidence in response to a factual statement about the masteries
*>*calls me stubborn

Exquisite, absolutely exquisite.

It's exquisite how you aren't capable to see to how it's better for a champ at a certain point to sacrifice armor for damage because of how  damage mitigation sistem works, and how instead to answer to my points you keep trying to dodge them
